title: Tackling the Art of Writing: Tips from an Early Career Researcher
content: American author and environmental activist Edward Abbey once posed the question, ‘What is the essence of the art of writing?’ His answer: ‘Part One: Have something to say. Part Two: Say it well.’11 Good writing takes time. It takes practice, it takes patience. While seeing your ideas develop on the page can be exciting, it can also feel intimidating and frustrating. As I enter my seventh year post-PhD, there is no doubt that I am still searching for the magic spell that aids the writing process. Coming to understand writing as a craft,22 something that requires work in and of itself, can be challenging. Writing is an ever-evolving time-consuming skill. Practice, patience and trial and error play a key role in developing this, but there is also a role for shared insights and practical tips.33 With this in mind, what follows are a handful of key thoughts from the lessons I have learned and things that have helped me during the early stages of my career.
